result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew R. Feest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Probation can terminate after 6 months if restitution is paid and there is no violations.

miscConds.notes:
*AMENDMENT 9/8/2017 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect correct payment language as follows:
Pay restitution in the amount of $2,457.15 and restitution surcharge.

Pay court costs.  
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
----------------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No contact with victim Jeffrey McKone without victim's and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------------

timeConds.notes: Complete forty (40) hours of community service work during the period of probation ordered WITHOUT buyout option.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew R. Feest

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew R. Feest in court with attorney Kelly Courtenay Nickel.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Attorney Kelly Courtenay Nickel appeared.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance waived by the Court.  Matter before the Court for rescheduling. Scheduling orders provided to the parties.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew R. Feest in court with attorney Kelly Courtenay Nickel.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 08-15-16. Bond remains.  Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.M.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Andrew R. Feest in court with attorney Kelly Courtenay Nickel.  Andrew Robert Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
